intro: Amphione chenopodia, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. Amphione chenopodia is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
